com.wm.util.coder

Class IDataJSONCoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.util.coder.IDataCoder
      • com.wm.util.coder.IDataJSONCoder

  • public class IDataJSONCoder
extends IDataCoder
    This class encodes an Integration Server document to JSON and decodes JSON to an Integration Server document. The encode(OutputStream, IData) and decode(InputStream) methods are called directly from client applications or from these public services:
    • pub.json:jsonStreamToDocument
    • pub.json:documentToJSONString
    • pub.json:jsonStringToDocument
    IDataJSONCoder uses the Jackson library to parse and generate JSON. Jackson attempts to conform to the published JSON standard, RFC 4627. It does not use a convention, such as Badgerfish, to represent XML in JSON.
    See Also:
    JSON, RFC 4627, Jackson documentation

        public java.lang.String getContentType()

        Returns:

      • encode

        public void encode(java.io.OutputStream os,
                   IData data)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   InvalidDatatypeException
        Converts an Integration Server document to JSON and writes it to the supplied OutputStream. The format of the JSON content generated by encode(OutputStream, IData) is controlled by the watt.server.json.prettyPrint property. The default setting for this property is false, which causes encode to generate compact JSON, with no additional carriage returns or indentation. If watt.server.json.prettyPrint is true, the generated JSON is formatted with carriage returns and indentation to make the output easier to read. You can override the setting of this property by calling the setPrettyPrint(boolean) method prior to the encode method.

        Field names in the generated JSON text are enclosed in double quotes by default. This conforms to the JSON standard. If the JSON text will be consumed by an older JavaScript processor that does not handle quoted field names correctly, you can set the watt.server.json.quoteFieldNames property to false to change this.

        Specified by:
        encode in class IDataCoder
        Parameters:
        os - the OutputStream to write the JSON content to
        data - an Integration Server document to be transformed into JSON
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        InvalidDatatypeException - If the data in the IData object cannot be encoded (i.e., the IData object contains an object type that is not supported by the specific implementation of encode that you are using).
        See Also:
        #encode(OutputStream,Values)

      • decode

        public IData decode(java.io.InputStream is)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    InvalidDatatypeException
        Converts a stream of JSON content into an Integration Server document. Field names in JSON text must be enclosed in double quotes. If you intend to parse legacy JavaScript that does not have quoted field names, you can relax this requirement by setting the watt.server.json.allowUnquotedFieldNames property to true.
        Specified by:
        decode in class IDataCoder
        Parameters:
        is - an InputStream holding JSON content
        Returns:
        an Integration Server document as an instance of Values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while reading the InputStream or writing to the IData object.
        InvalidDatatypeException - If the content of InputStream cannot an be properly parsed and decoded.
        See Also:
        #decodeToIData(InputStream)

      • setDecodeRealAsDouble

        public void setDecodeRealAsDouble(boolean value)
        Indicates to the IDataJSONCoder whether to convert real numbers in the JSON content to java.lang.Floats or java.lang.Doubles.
        Parameters:
        value - If true, real numbers will be converted to Doubles. If false, real numbers will be converted to Floats.

      • setDecodeIntegerAsLong

        public void setDecodeIntegerAsLong(boolean value)
        Indicates to the IDataJSONCoder whether to convert integer numbers in the JSON content to java.lang.Longs or java.lang.Integers.
        Parameters:
        value - If true, real numbers will be converted to Longs. If false, real numbers will be converted to Integers.

      • setPrettyPrint

        public void setPrettyPrint(boolean prettyPrint)
        Indicates to the IDataJSONCoder whether to use pretty print to format the JSON output. Call this method prior to calling #encode(OutputStream, Values) or encode(OutputStream, IData) in order to override the current setting of the watt.server.json.prettyPrint property.
        Parameters:
        prettyPrint - If true, calls to the encode methods will generate JSON formatted with carriage returns and indentation to make the JSON output easier to read. If false, the generated JSON will not include carriage returns or indentation.

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(IDataJSONCoder.JSON_ENCODING encoding)
        Indicates to the IDataJSONCoder which character encoding to use. Valid values for encoding are defined by the enum JSON_ENCODING.
        Parameters:
        encoding - Specifies the encoding to use.
